Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: narrow reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; upper wall reserved with one black band, glazed below; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, it possibly find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9A. The type closely follows the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type VIII (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. The number in Petrie's catalogue, 130, is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 130)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 652, no. 91)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.364) (Phase 3)
